channel.title: Error Loading Please Report--->Aggroth I need help please
channel.description: I got Aggroth client+source, but when i run my client it says error loading please report, i went on signlink.java and put C:/Aggroth/ and i had a folder in my C: drive called Aggroth i also put one in the guest user since im on guest but they both didnt seem to help? i also compiled the client but it still didn't work i got the latest jdk/java please can anyone help? :confused: :confused:

item.title: Error Loading Please Report--->Aggroth I need help please
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:17, topic:544573”][quote author=matzie link=topic=663453.msg4434912#msg4434912 date=1404757543]
I do thing the “null” in “nullMaps\mapConfig.txt” is from invalid class path.
This thread is for server issues not client issues >_<’ why can’t people scroll down a little bit farther?
I suggest starting your search there.
[/quote]
Lol’d.

But yes, this is more of a client sided issue.

there is no “guest.home” property. It would still be “user.home”

Zyle is right.
user.home in java means the current user’s (meaning you, regardless of the account you logged into windows with) home directory.[/quote]
Yea i don’t know what was wrong with me that night lol.[quote=“matzie, post:14, topic:544573”]I do think the “null” in “nullMaps\mapConfig.txt” is from an invalid file path.
This section is for server issues not client issues >_<’ why can people not scroll down a little bit further?
I suggest starting your search there.[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: Error Loading Please Report--->Aggroth I need help please

item.title: Error Loading Please Report--->Aggroth I need help please
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“matzie, post:14, topic:544573”]I do thing the “null” in “nullMaps\mapConfig.txt” is from invalid class path.
This thread is for server issues not client issues >_<’ why can’t people scroll down a little bit farther?
I suggest starting your search there.[/quote]
Lol’d.

But yes, this is more of a client sided issue.

zyle1992:

there is no “guest.home” property. It would still be “user.home”

Zyle is right.
user.home in java means the current user’s (meaning you, regardless of the account you logged into windows with) home directory.

Read full topic

From Aggroth V4, freshly extracted:

Compile client

Remove cache from C:/

Start client

item.title: Error Loading Please Report--->Aggroth I need help please
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“privatescape, post:11, topic:544573”]This is what the black box says when i run the client P.S. what do i do with the cache i downloaded?

Aggroth is loading…
java.io.FileNotFoundException: nullMaps\mapConfig.txt (The system cannot find th
e path specified)
at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method)
at java.io.FileInputStream.(Unknown Source)
at java.io.FileInputStream.(Unknown Source)
at java.io.FileReader.(Unknown Source)
at client.setNewMaps(client.java:140)
at client.startUp(client.java:9342)
at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33)
at client.run(client.java:6247)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
java.lang.NullPointerException
at java.io.File.(Unknown Source)
at Update.(Update.java:25)
at client.streamLoaderForName(client.java:4940)
at client.startUp(client.java:9352)
at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33)
at client.run(client.java:6247)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)[/quote]

I do thing the “null” in “nullMaps\mapConfig.txt” is from invalid class path.
This thread is for server issues not client issues >_<’ why can’t people scroll down a little bit farther?
I suggest starting your search there.

Read full topic

item.title: Error Loading Please Report--->Aggroth I need help please
item.dc:creator: @Camballer Camballer
item.description:
@Camballer wrote:

Change your findcachedir() method in signlink.java to System.getProperty(“user.home”);

item.title: Error Loading Please Report--->Aggroth I need help please
item.dc:creator: @Camballer Camballer
item.description:
@Camballer wrote:

Don’t extract it. It was just to test whether or not the link was still valid, which could have been a reason why you were getting the error. Are there any errors in the CMD when you run the client? If so, post them. It’s hard for me to guess.

Read full topic
item.source: Error Loading Please Report--->Aggroth I need help please

item.title: Error Loading Please Report--->Aggroth I need help please
item.dc:creator: @privatescape privatescape
item.description:
@privatescape wrote:

Camballer:

Chaosplaya has absolutely no clue what he’s talking about. He’s trying to raise his post count. The error has to do with your cache not the ip address the client is trying to connect to. Check in your cachedownloader, make sure the link to the cache it’s trying to download is valid. If not, re-zip, re-upload, and insert the new link. Compile then try again. Let me know if you need help.

in the cache downloader there was a link to the cache, right now im downloading it,where should i extract it?

Read full topic
item.source: Error Loading Please Report--->Aggroth I need help please

item.title: Error Loading Please Report--->Aggroth I need help please
item.dc:creator: @Camballer Camballer
item.description:
@Camballer wrote:

Chaosplaya has absolutely no clue what he’s talking about. He’s trying to raise his post count. The error has to do with your cache not the ip address the client is trying to connect to. Check in your cachedownloader, make sure the link to the cache it’s trying to download is valid. If not, re-zip, re-upload, and insert the new link. Compile then try again. Let me know if you need help.
